camel.sink.endpoint.servers.name: camel.sink.endpoint.servers
camel.sink.endpoint.servers.description: The hostnames of one or more nsqlookupd servers (consumer) or nsqd servers (producer)

camel.sink.endpoint.userAgent.name: camel.sink.endpoint.userAgent
camel.sink.endpoint.userAgent.description: A String to identify the kind of client

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.port.name: camel.sink.endpoint.port
camel.sink.endpoint.port.description: The port of the nsqd server

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.secure.name: camel.sink.endpoint.secure
camel.sink.endpoint.secure.description: Set secure option indicating TLS is required

camel.component.nsq.servers.name: camel.component.nsq.servers
camel.component.nsq.servers.description: The hostnames of one or more nsqlookupd servers (consumer) or nsqd servers (producer).

camel.component.nsq.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.nsq.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.nsq.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.nsq.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.component.nsq.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.nsq.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.nsq.useGlobalSslContextP.name: camel.component.nsq.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.nsq.useGlobalSslContextP.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
